company_updates.reshared_post_description:
We successfully wrapped up the Third Edition of the Muscat International Forum for Risk Management, organized by the Central Bank of Oman and the Union of Arab Banks. 

I was happy to join a deep discussion of issues related to proper governance and culture in financial institutions. The turmoil of 2023 taught us many lessons on building and maintaining a proper culture in financial institutions. Keeping with the theme of financial turmoil in 2023, I also led a discussion of new liquidity measurement / monitoring dynamics and consumer behaviors in the era social media. 

The GCC has a young, tech-savvy, and values-driven population that needs special attention in building brand recognition and maintaining brand loyalty. This is now even more of a challenge in the era of social media, Fintech competition, and digital transformation. We are now seeing emergence and maturity of digital assets and tokenization as serious competition as well. All of this of course affects how a bank manages its liquidity needs, which also ties back to maintaining a proper corporate culture. 

Already looking forward to the Fourth Edition of this increasingly valuable forum!

UAE e-invoicing: Phased Rollout Confirmed for 2026

The UAE Ministry of Finance has officially set out the roadmap for mandatory e-invoicing for businesses, with implementation beginning in July 2026. This marks a significant step in the UAEâ€™s digital tax transformation journey, aligning with global best practices and driving real-time tax transparency.

At Grant Thornton UAE, we break down what this means for businesses:
- Phased implementation based on turnover, starting with a pilot in July 2026 and mandatory adoption for large businesses from January 2027.
- ERP and accounting systems must be upgraded to generate structured e-invoices and comply with new data and reporting standards.
- Master data and transaction flows should be validated now to ensure readiness and avoid last-minute challenges.
- Appointment of Accredited Service Providers (ASPs) is mandatory - businesses should plan early to integrate systems and ensure compliance.

Our latest article covers:
- The legal foundations and regulatory milestones
- The detailed transition timeline and who is affected
- Practical steps for compliance and how to turn this mandate into a strategic advantage

#GTOffshore is proud to share a major milestone for our Restructuring and Insolvency team at Grant Thornton - UAE.
 
Following Matthew Devine CAâ€™s registration as a Licensed Insolvency Practitioner in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) earlier this year, we would like to extend our congratulations to Sameer Khan for earning the same recognition in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). 
 
These appointments further strengthen our ability to support clients across the UAEâ€™s two leading financial free zones. With licensed practitioners in both DIFC and ADGM, we are enhancing our already robust cross-jurisdictional capabilities ensuring tailored, strategic support wherever our clients operate.
 
Why this matters:
 
DIFC and ADGM both operate under English common law but have distinct regulatory frameworks and sector focuses.
Our dual licensing ensures we can provide on-the-ground expertise in both jurisdictions, helping businesses navigate complex financial challenges with confidence and clarity.
 
â€œThis marks a significant step in my professional journey with Grant Thornton and I am eager to contribute to the dynamic and evolving financial landscape of the DIFC. I look forward to leveraging my expertise to assist businesses in navigating financial challenges and driving sustainable growth.â€ â€“ Matthew Devine
 
â€œBeing licensed in ADGM allows us to deepen our impact in a jurisdiction thatâ€™s rapidly becoming a global hub for innovation and investment. I am excited to help clients unlock value and resilience through proactive restructuring and asset recovery strategies.â€ â€“ Sameer Khan
 
Please do reach out to Matthew or Sameer to learn more.
 
#DIFC #ADGM #Leadership #ProfessionalMilestone
